ğŸ”¹ Whatâ€™s going on?  
â€¢ The Trello MCP server tries to start by running `tsx supporting-systems/trello-integration/index.ts`.  
â€¢ On launch it immediately imports `dotenv`.  
â€¢ `dotenv` (and the rest of the node-modules folder) isnâ€™t installed locally â†’ Node throws `ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND`, so the server crashes before it can register any tools. Cursor then shows â€œ0 tools enabledâ€ with the red dot.

ğŸ”¹ Quick fix  
1. From the repo root run:  
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```  
   (or `pnpm install` / `yarn` â€“ whichever you use).  
2. Toggle the Trello server back on; it should now load, list its tools, and the red dot will disappear.

ğŸ”¹ Why it happened  
â€¢ The old `node_modules_OLD_â€¦` folder in `archive/` suggests dependencies were blown away during a cleanup or move.  
â€¢ The MCP UI relies on the process exiting cleanly; any missing package will silently break the connection.

Try the install and let me know if anything else pops up. ğŸ¤–
